description: Construction of a four storey building to provide two ground floor units retail/professional services (E(a) and E(g) (i)  Use Classes) and 6 x self-contained residential units at first, second and third floor levels incorporating external balconies to the rear facade  including associated car parking, cycle storage and refuse storage provision at 51-53 The Green, Southall (following demolition of buildings); and construction of pitched roof at No. 55 The Green, Southall
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s)Location Plan ref. 1759-os-01, received 20 February 2018; Existing Plans and Elevations ref. 1759-ex-01, received 20 February 2018; Existing Floor Plans - No 55 & 55A ref. 1759-ex-02m received 20 February 2018;; Elevations ref. 1759-pl-04 rev A, received 11 April 2018; Blox B - Cycle Shelter ref. BX/MW/BLOX/B/41/OF-FSC, received 11 April 2018, Floor Plans ref. 1759-pl-03 rev B, received 14/08/2023,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021). | The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| The cycle parking facilities for a minimum of twelve cycle spaces hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first use of any part of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The cycle parking for the residential component shall be provided and located in a secure undercover and lockable compound.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation, for the installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh.  The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy SI 1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on the elevation facing The Green, with intake from the rear of the building. The approved mitigation scheme shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy SI 1 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval of external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial sources and details of the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) to achieve internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval, of the external sound level emitted from plant/ machinery/ equipment associated with residential and commercial uses and mitigation measures as appropriate.  The measures shall ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from plant, machinery/ equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5 dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact on noise sensitive receivers in the surrounding area. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. Details of any noise mitigation measures shall be submitted for approval.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy D 14 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment, and extract/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and surrounding properties in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), Policy D 14 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of an enhanced  sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely lounges of third floor flats above bedrooms of second floor flats]. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy D 14 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of the sound insulation of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial part(s) of the premises from dwellings [noise sensitive premises].  Details shall demonstrate that the sound insulation value DnT,w  [and L'nT,w ]  is enhanced by at least 10dB above the Building Regulations value and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures are implemented to contain commercial noise within the commercial premises and to achieve the criteria of BS8233:2014 within the dwellings/ noise sensitive premises.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy D 14 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the commercial part of the development, a Servicing Management Plan shall be submitted for approval in writing by the Council. Details shall include hours of use, times and frequency of activities, deliveries and collections, vehicle movements, silent reversing etc.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and surrounding properties in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy E9 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a demolition method statement and a construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.  Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period.

Reason: To protect residential amenity and ensure pedestrian and highway safety in accordance with policy T4 and T6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| The vehicle parking arrangement shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and this space shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policies T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (2021); and section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), the ground floor commercial units shall not be subdivided and shall only be used for an E(a) or E(g)(i) activity, and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use, and to safeguard the vitality and viability of the shopping and town centre in accordance with policy E9 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1(d), 2.7(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); and policy 4C of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
